contextId.occurrenceNote: These two phrases mean the same thing and can be combined. Alternate translation: "he did not let Joshua quickly conquer them and drive them out" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.glQuote: did not drive them out quickly and give them into the hand of Joshua

contextId.occurrenceNote: These two words basically mean the same and emphasize how much the Israelites suffered. Alternate translation: "terribly oppressed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])

These two words basically have the same meaning repeated to emphasize how important Jephthah had became. You can combine the two words. Alternate translation: "commander" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])

The words "advice" and "counsel" refer to the same thing and are repeated for emphasis. They can be combined. Alternate translation: "decide what we need to do about this" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.glQuote: give your advice and counsel here
